title: Israel’s Failure to Fully Conquer Canaan
summary: Judges 1 recounts Israel’s initial victories and failures in conquering the land after Joshua’s death. Some tribes drive out enemies, but many fail to fully take possession, allowing Canaanites to remain.

faq.question: What does this chapter show about Israel’s conquest?
faq.answer: While some victories are achieved, many tribes fail to completely drive out the inhabitants.

faq.question: What is the consequence of not driving out the Canaanites?
faq.answer: These nations become a source of temptation and trouble for Israel later.
